meanings.definition: Arranged in two rows or series.
meanings.sent1: The biseriate pattern of the flowers made the garden look very organized.
meanings.sent2: The bookshelf had a biseriate arrangement of books, making it easy to find each one.
meanings.sent3: The biseriate layout of the cookies on the plate made them look like little soldiers standing in formation.
meanings.sent4: The biseriate rows of trees along the path created a mesmerizing effect, like a natural corridor.
meanings.sent5: The biseriate design of the quilt added a unique touch to the room decor.

meanings.sent1: The classroom had a biseriate seating plan, with desks neatly aligned in two rows.
meanings.sent2: The necklace had a biseriate chain, giving it a symmetrical and elegant look.
meanings.sent3: The biseriate stripes on the cat's fur made it look like a tiny zebra.
meanings.sent4: The biseriate pattern of stars in the night sky seemed to form a celestial pathway.
meanings.sent5: The biseriate design of the building's windows added a modern touch to its facade.

meanings.definition: To arrange in two rows or series.
meanings.sent1: She decided to biseriate the books on the shelf to make them easier to browse.
meanings.sent2: The gardener biseriated the plants along the path for a more structured garden layout.
meanings.sent3: The chef biseriated the ingredients on the cutting board before starting to cook.
meanings.sent4: The artist biseriated the colors on the canvas, creating a harmonious composition.
meanings.sent5: He carefully biseriated the tiles on the floor to achieve a uniform and neat look.
